events.name: Ruby Tea Party October 24
events.description:
Your chance to sit down and dedicate yourself to learning programming. 


Our goal is to make the Ruby on Rails community in Singapore more inclusive for women and other minorities - so if you know anyone that codes or that you think would enjoy learning to code, invite them along!  


If this is your first time, don't worry! We will help you get set up and going in no time.  

If you are eager, have a look at www.tryruby.org (Do the first 3 or 4 levels - stop when you get to Files and Directories!)  

And then get started on  http://guides.railsgirls.com/app/. 

See you Monday!

events.name: Restarting Drupal Singapore Meetups: Creating and Modifying Forms in Drupal 8
events.description: Who's interested in kick-starting the Singapore Drupal meetups again? It's been a while since we last got together and there's been lots happening with Drupal 8. So, I propose we get back into our regular monthly meetups with one on Monday, October 24 at SmartSpace. Sorry, it's a bit rushed but my calendar is pretty packed these days.  The topic will be: "Creating and Modifying Forms in Drupal 8". This is an intermediate level topic for site-builders and developers where I'll explain how to programatically create a form in Drupal 8 using the new FormBase class and how to modify an existing form using the familiar hook_form_alter() function found in previous Drupal versions. After the talk, we'll propose some additional topics for future meetups. Please come prepared with your own topic ideas you like to hear or, even better, speak about. Here are a few of my ideas to get you thinking. - Why Drupal is still relevant- Behat in Drupal 8- Creating a content repository- Drupal DevOps We're not going to provide food or drinks this time since organizing it (and cleaning up afterwards) is time-consuming and seems to be one of the reasons we got tired of planning the meetups. So, we'll keep it simple and just focused on Drupal. But, feel free to bring snacks and drinks for yourself and for sharing! As always, we'll convene downstairs at the food court for dinner, drinks and conversations after the meetup. Looking forward to seeing you all on the 24th. Joe.

events.name: Practical Data Science at Honestbee
events.description: Hi all! This month, we are excited to have Dat Le and his team to share with us how Honestbee applies data science and data engineering in eGrocery!   • RSVPs will open on Sunday, 16th Oct (12pm) and close on 24th October (12pm). • Please refer to the new attendance policy before RSVP to this meetup.  Event details 7pm - 7.15pm: Networking session [casual; small talk]  7.15pm - 8pm: Practical Data Science at Honestbee [core level] 8pm - 8.30pm: Networking session [casual; small talk]  [] : Suggested rating and topic; ranges from: newbie - casual - core - hardcore. About our speaker: Dat Le is currently Data Science Lead at Honestbee. He did his Bachelors in Computer Science at the University of Nottingham (2009) and Masters at the University of Oxford (2010). He built the Data Warehouse and Data Team at Zalora in 2013-2014, Commercialize TV from 2014 - 2015 and is now transforming the eGrocery scene at Honestbee. He’s a data enthusiast - he loves contributing to open-source data projects in Python / Haskell / Shellscripts and participating in data science challenges in his free time.
events.location: SMU school of accountancy/school of law seminar room 2-4, 60 Stamford Road, 178900, Singapore
